My bit gold design in 1998 was 2-layer: bit gold for settlement, Chaumian e-cash for a privacy-enhanced payments layer. I've always thought of Bitcoin as evolving into a settlements-and-large-payments layer that in the long term needed a layer 2 for consumer payments.

Crucial point. "Digital cash" was dreamed up by academic cryptographers long before Bitcoin. It was a privacy-enhanced way to pay in dollars or euro, not a new currency. Many in crypto academia still don't get the idea of an independent currency & its very different requirements.https://twitter.com/waxwing__/status/1012221025503891456 …

1/ I used to be a big night person, in fact I learnt about # Bitcoin in an IRC chat room around 3am. I would wake up late in the day and stay awake into the wee hours of the night. I used to think this was production, but prison changed that.

Gambling was one of the primary uses of Bitcoin, we had satoshi dice back in the day, people loved it, I never used it since I'm not that kind of a gambler. It's a solid use case. I personally would also love to see more games and other things but people want what they want.

With the rise of the # Bitcoin fees an often heard criticism was that people can no longer use it for micro-payments and things like satoshi dice. Now we already have https://www.lightningspin.com/  and I'm sure more gambling websites will pop up. I prefer to gamble on altcoins and Bitmex
